# UIDocumentViewController.LaunchOptions

**Class**

Options for customizing the document launch view.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor class LaunchOptions
```

## Overview

When your app launches, the document view controller displays a view that contains a title and buttons to create new documents. It also displays the document browser as a sheet over the title view. For more information, see [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/customizing-a-document-based-app-s-launch-experience].

## Configuring the appearance

- **title**: The title that appears in the title view.
- **background**: A configuration that describes the launch scene’s background.
- **documentTargetView**: The document target view.
- **browserViewController**: The document browser view controller.

## Adding accessory views

- **backgroundAccessoryView**: A view that appears behind the title view in the launch scene.
- **foregroundAccessoryView**: A view that appears in front of the title view in the launch scene.

## Adding actions

- **primaryAction**: The launch scene’s primary action.
- **secondaryAction**: The launch scene’s secondary action.

## Creating documents

- **createDocumentAction(withIntent:)**: Creates an action that uses the specified intent.

## Customizing the launch experience

- **launchOptions**: Options that customize a document-based app’s launch view.

## Inherits From

- NSObject

## Conforms To

- CVarArg
- CustomDebugStringConvertible
- CustomStringConvertible
- Equatable
- Hashable
- NSObjectProtocol
- Sendable
